Local Transport Plan

Pedestrian Strategy

Walking is an important mode of travel
column2: both in its own right and in the integration of all other modes such as public transport and the private car. In view of this
column3: the Council recognises that improving facilities for pedestrians is a key priority for the successful delivery of an integrated transport strategy.

column1: A Draft Merseyside Pedestrian Strategy has been developed to supplement the second Local Transport Plan (LTP2) for Merseyside. The strategy sets out Merseyside’s policy towards encouraging walking and pedestrian improvements and has been developed in line with Government policy to achieve an overall sustainable transport strategy. The Draft Pedestrian Strategy will be the subject of a consultation exercise during 2006.
Increasing the levels of walking in the Borough will be achieved through reducing traffic speeds in certain areas
column3: providing training and promoting the associated health benefits of walking.
